articles.author: Nandita Bose, Jarrett Renshaw, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris wasted no time launching her 2024 presidential campaign, seeking the support of fellow Democrats with the backing of President Joe Biden after he pulled out of the race amid concerns about his age and health.
articles.title: Backed by Biden, Harris moves to lock up White House bid

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris's campaign officials, allies, and supporters have started making calls to secure the support of delegates for her nomination ahead of the Democratic National Convention in August, multiple sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris campaign, allies calling delegates to lock in support before convention, sources say

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Activists opposing Israel's war in Gaza and Washington's support for its Middle Eastern ally plan protests at the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday to coincide with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's U.S. visit this week.
articles.title: Activists plan protests during Netanyahu's Washington visit this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump told CNN on Sunday that he thinks Vice President Kamala Harris will be easier to defeat in November's election than Democratic President Joe Biden who stepped aside as his party's candidate.
articles.title: Trump says Kamala Harris will be easier to defeat than Biden

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Palestinian fighters in the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday, and struck areas in the centre of the coastal enclave where thousands of Palestinians displaced from their homes have been seeking shelter.
articles.title: Fighting rages in southern Gaza, Israeli strikes hit central areas

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits Washington this week, under pressure to end the Gaza war both from Israelis who want hostages brought home and from a U.S. administration focusing increasingly on the presidential election.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu heading to Washington with US in flux over election race

articles.author: Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan started its annual Han Kuang war games on Monday, which this year aim to be as close as possible to actual combat with no script and simulating how to repel a Chinese attack.
articles.title: Taiwan starts annual war games, aiming to closely mimic actual combat

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly, Nandita Bose, Bianca Flowers
articles.description: Many Democrats on Sunday quickly backed Vice President Kamala Harris to run as the party's presidential nominee against Donald Trump after incumbent President Joe Biden's abrupt departure from the race, but some powerful party members, including former House of Representatives speaker Nancy Pelosi, stayed quiet.
articles.title: Kamala Harris wins 2024 backing of many Democrats, but Pelosi, others are silent

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Black Sea Tuapse oil refinery, owned by oil major Rosneft , was damaged in a Ukrainian drone attack overnight, officials from the Krasnodar region said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia's Tuapse oil refinery damaged in Ukraine drone attack, Russian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The attack prolonged an escalation of violence that began with a deadly Houthi drone strike on Tel Aviv on Friday and an Israeli air raid near Yemen's Hodeidah port on Saturday that killed six and injured 80.
articles.title: Israel says it intercepts missile fired from Yemen, Houthis say they targeted Eilat
